intro: Petalocentrum bicornutum, commonly known as the two-horned petal plant, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive two-horned calyx that resembles a petal, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in wetlands or along water bodies. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, with a showy appearance that attracts pollinators. The leaves are ovate and have a soft, hairy texture, contributing to its unique botanical profile.
